args: Taro resolved to climb up a mountain to see\nthe first sunrise of the year from its peak.\nI had to get the inside scoop on his motivation.
I'm trying to make a wish. See,\nmy father once told me a story...

He said that if I watch the year's first
sunrise from a place close to the sun,
I'll be blessed with the fortune to
achieve my goals!
I'll do anything to become a first-rate\nsamurai—so up a mountain I go!

It was New Year's Eve, and Taro prepared to
make his fateful ascent. The place he'd set his
sights was hardly the highest peak of Kleifheim,
but it was good enough for him.
*pant* A pox on this precipitous peak...\n*wheeze*
We've only just begun to hike!\nWe have to reach the summit\nbefore dawn, and you CAN do it!
How do you have so much energy?
I'm sure you'd have more if you weren't\nwearing all that heavy armor.
Seriously. I can't pretend to be\nan expert on samurai logic...
...but you'd be way better-equipped to\nmake the climb if you shed all those\nextra pounds you're carrying around.
This armor is an extension of my being!\nI'd sooner die than cast it aside!
I also feel like there must be an easier\nway to scale this mountain... Is this\nreally the designated path?
You kidding? I'd never take the easy way\nup. We're on maximum difficulty here,\nfriend! We're gonna EARN this sunrise!
WHAT?! I'm not here to thrill-seek!
But overcoming so much hardship on the\ntrek up will make the sunrise that much\nmore beautiful when you see it!
Why are you agreeing with him?\n...Not that I necessarily disagree.
All right! I will prove that I am mightier\nthan some mountain! Let's do this!
Come on, Taro! But watch your footing—\nif you slip and fall, it's game over!
Of course it is. Haven't you ever heard\nthe saying? ＂The bigger the mountain,\nthe bigger the—＂
Please stop talking and help me fight it!
Their journey was fraught with peril, but\nthey rose to the challenge time and again.
The water level here's really high.
But not TOO high! Caulk your wagons,\nboys, because we're fording this river!
GAH! Cold! My armor's so heavy!\nBrrrrrrrr...
But eventually, Taro reached his limit.
What's wrong, Taro?! Talk to u—
What was going through his head\nat that moment? I simply had to know.
I wanted to go back to Hinomoto.\nThat was all I could think.
But then, out of the darkness in my\nheart...arose a sudden burst of passion.
The desire to see the sun rise, and to\nwin its blessings, exploded within me,\npulling me to my feet!
Phew! We were running around like\nchickens with our heads cut off!
Ha ha. I'm sorry for worrying you.
But I'm okay now. I WILL reach the peak\nbefore dawn! Samurai's honor!
That's the spirit! I'll be cheering\nyou on the whole way there!
Heh. Then let's get a move on, shall we?
We made it. There's the summit.
Look, Taro! The rising sun is so beautiful!
Aha ha... We made it... We made it to the\nmountain's peak, kissed by the rising sun!
...Wait, this is no time to get sentimental!\nI need to start praying!
(O rising sun, grant me your blessings!\nMay this be the year I become a first-rate\nsamurai!)
Aaand done. Hm? Aren't you two going\nto pray?
Heh. I'll let you have all the good fortune.
I-I see. What about you, Emma?
I'm good! I only came here to support you.\nBesides...
I plan on praying to Apollo when I get back\nanyway!
He's the guardian of the town where\nI work. People call him an avatar\nof the sun.
If you go and greet him, you get the\nsun's blessing! I do it every year!
An avatar of the sun? The sun's blessing?!
Heh. That sounds just like what Taro\nhere was after.
Hee hee. That's not all! He's even\nbeen known to personally come and\nvisit warriors who train really hard!
Heh heh... Sounds like there was a\nmuch easier way for you to get the\nsun's blessings after all, Taro!
Oh, but it IS so! I get loads of energy\nfrom Apollo every single year!
Seriously?! Everything I endured...\nAll my passion... What was it even for?
The doom and gloom's a bit much, pal.\nWe had some real thrills—isn't that its\nown reward?
MAYBE FOR YOU! NOT FOR ME!
Finally, I asked Taro if he'd be\nmaking the hike again next year.
I'll go and see Apollo instead!
